name: Dott
slogan: We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life
description:
We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. Our mission is to beautifully design micromobility for safety, comfort, and durability.

We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million and just released €30 million series A funding, co-led by existing investors EQT Ventures and Naspers, through its Naspers Ventures division, Axel Springer Digital Ventures, Felix Capital, FJ Labs, U-Start Club and angel investors.

Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is now operating in Brussels, Paris, Lyon, Milan & soon launching in other European cities

jobs.title: Senior Data Analyst
jobs.description:
We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. Our mission is to beautifully design micromobility for safety, comfort, and durability.

We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million and just released €30 million series A funding, co-led by existing investors EQT Ventures and Naspers, through its Naspers Ventures division, Axel Springer Digital Ventures, Felix Capital, FJ Labs, U-Start Club and angel investors.

Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is now operating in Brussels, Paris, Lyon, Turin, Munich & soon launching in other European cities.

At Dott, we believe data should be at the heart of everything we do. We are looking for someone who embodies that philosophy  and  who is capable of driving data-centricity throughout the whole company. You will work with Operations, Product, IoT and Engineering on highly technical and challenging projects that touch the real and the virtual world.


What you'll do: 
- Work with operations and product teams to set objectives, identify improvement opportunities and prioritize product features based on business priorities
- You build hypotheses on fleet and rider performance and validate them using statistical modeling
- You play a key role in the development and deployment of data science tools that help our teams run their operations more efficiently 
- You build highly engaging dashboards that help decision makers make better choices 
- Democratize data by supporting the construction of a self-service metrics mart, using cutting-edge technologies 
- Work with functional managers to outline the specific data needs for each business analytical project


What you'll need: 
- Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics or Computer Engineering
- 3+ years working as a data analyst 
- Excellent communicator, you are energized by collaboration with people across the board
- Experience working in dynamic high growth environment 
- Fluent and passionate about SQL, experience with Python/R is a big plus 
- Experience working with the Google Cloud Platform is a big plus 
- Experience working with geospatial data is a big plus
- Strong attention to detail


Want to come along for the ride? Let’s do this right - together.

jobs.title: Senior Data Engineer
jobs.description:
We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. Our mission is to beautifully design micromobility for safety, comfort, and durability.

We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million and just released €30 million series A funding, co-led by existing investors EQT Ventures and Naspers, through its Naspers Ventures division, Axel Springer Digital Ventures, Felix Capital, FJ Labs, U-Start Club and angel investors.

Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is now operating in Brussels, Paris, Lyon, Turin, Munich & soon launching in other European cities.

We’re looking for a Data Engineer with a strong experience and passion for building robust scalable infrastructures and discovering hidden patterns that can be leveraged to drive the micro-mobility business forward.


What you'll do
- Define, build and maintain business intelligence stack
- Enable data-driven decision making through interactive dashboards and self-service analytics tools
- Build a deep understanding of the way people move through cities and create the systems that will help them move faster  
- Create data models for the analysis of a high-volume of product AB-tests 
- Mine and analyze data to find opportunities for development, product and process optimization  
- Support in creating and maintaining data pipelines on GCP
- Work closely with business, product and engineering and strengthen data-driven thinking in the culture


What you'll need
- 3-5 years of experience in the field of data engineering 
- Experience constructing ETL processes, both in batch and realtime  
- Expert in Python and SQL 
- Experience with creating data modelling and managing data warehouses
- Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques is a big plus 
- Experience with Airflow is a big plus 
- Experience working with the google cloud platform and BigQuery is a big plus


Along with a competitive compensation plan, we also invite employees to participate in our employee stock option plan, plus other benefits.


Want to come along for the ride? Let’s do this right - together.

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Developer
jobs.description:
We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. Our mission is to beautifully design micromobility for safety, comfort, and durability.

We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million and just released €30 million series A funding, co-led by existing investors EQT Ventures and Naspers, through its Naspers Ventures division, Axel Springer Digital Ventures, Felix Capital, FJ Labs, U-Start Club and angel investors.

Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is now operating in Brussels, Paris, Lyon, Turin, Munich & soon launching in other European cities.

We’re looking for a Senior Frontend developer with a strong passion for crafting delightful user experience and a great attention to detail. As part of a strong and diverse platform team you will have the ability to work on consumer and internal applications, built on the latest stack to support business operations. You strive to create elegant architecture, clean testable code and a delightful user experience. You take the lead in discussion, challenge your peers and coach new joiners in getting up to speed.  


What you'll do:
- Work on high performance real-time internal web apps
- Work on our public website
- Work closely with product and design to craft the best user experience
- Define and drive development efforts using the latest web stacks 
- Coach new joiners and peers
- Assist in hiring top talent


What you'll need:
- At least 5 years of front end development experience out of which 2 years as a lead
- Excellent knowledge of modern native web technologies 
- Production experience with at least one modern web framework
- Interest in learning and applying new technologies and solutions
- Deep understanding of user experience
- High execution and ownership mindset
- Proven experience in delivering consumer applications in a timely manner
- Experience in mentoring team members
- Excellent English language and communication skills


Along with a competitive compensation plan, we also invite employees to participate in our employee stock option plan, plus other benefits.


Want to come along for the ride? Let’s do this right - together.

jobs.title: Operations & Fleet Management Specialist, Italy
jobs.description:
We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. Our mission is to beautifully design micromobility for safety, comfort, and durability.

We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million and just released €30 million series A funding, co-led by existing investors EQT Ventures and Naspers, through its Naspers Ventures division, Axel Springer Digital Ventures, Felix Capital, FJ Labs, U-Start Club and angel investors.

Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is now operating in Brussels, Paris, Lyon, Turin, Munich & soon launching in other European cities.

We’re looking for an entrepreneurial Operations Specialist to develop operations team for dott in Milan. This is an ideal role for early career professional interested in developing real world management skills. The Operations Specialist will report to the Operations Manager and will build and coordinate the whole logistic team.


What you’ll do:
- Build your own on-street team from scratch by recruiting, training and motivating team members.
- Be a true leader to a large and diverse team of patrollers (in charge of scooters use optimisation inside the city) and/or drivers.
- Organise scheduling, attendance, and general administration of your operations team.
- Maximise efficiency of fleet management & logistics by ensuring deployment, pickup and costs of dott scooters are optimised.
- Organise and manage the flow of the workplace and optimise day-to-day activities in the warehouse.
- Overseeing operations in the warehouse from facilities and vehicle upkeep to workplace safety.
- Maintain accurate communication with external stakeholders and carry out final decision making processes.
- Balance attention to detail with swift execution.
- Take full responsibility and ownership of projects and decisions that will impact the business.


What you’ll need:
- 2+ years  years of experience in retail, logistics, transportation, operations management or consulting.
- Have excellent communication and people skills. 
- Be able to justify your decisions to your team through data and measure the results.
- Get your hands dirty. Work directly with your staff on the ground. Be a true leader for our marshals and mechanics.
- Strong analytical/Excel skills a big plus.
- Fluent Italian & English speaker.  
- Entrepreneurship mentality. Make decisions, learn from you experience and repeat.
- Done is better than perfect. We need to move fast, but be mindful of our surroundings.
- The goal is to make our cities better, not worse!






Want to come along for the ride? Let’s do this right - together.

jobs.title: Central Marketing Senior Manager
jobs.description:
We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. Our mission is to beautifully design micromobility for safety, comfort, and durability.

We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million and just released €30 million series A funding, co-led by existing investors EQT Ventures and Naspers, through its Naspers Ventures division, Axel Springer Digital Ventures, Felix Capital, FJ Labs, U-Start Club and angel investors.

Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is now operating in Brussels, Paris, Lyon, Turin, Munich & soon launching in other European cities.


The Central Marketing Senior Manager is responsible for formulating strategic marketing plans with the aim to drive a strong brand positioning and ensure a sustainable marketing growth to achieve company business goals. He or she is responsible to act as a liaison between other functions, stakeholders and Local Marketing team to plan and roll out the full spectrum of marketing, communications and branding activities.

Area of accountabilities: 

Marketing & Comms strategy 
- Define quarterly strategic plans for Marketing & Comms, aligned with company goals and based on brand and consumer insights.
- Work closely with all stakeholders at the central level. Especially with the Design, Content and Product teams to ensure overall brand development across all communication and design materials are aligned.
- Build a robust consumer & brand understanding (based on both internal data and external research) to discover new insights. Translate those insights into creative briefs for new campaign / innovation / renovation. 


Coordination & management of local marketing
- Develop, train & lead a team that will execute strategies and activation ideas at local level:
 Help them understand local insights on brand and consumer segments
 Help them build their local city strategy & actions plan
 Liaise with all local teams for city events, partnerships and campaigns 
- Act as point of contact between Local Marketing team and Central stakeholders (designers, product managers, customer service…). 
- Organise weekly-calls across the marketing team and send out monthly marketing reports for the entire company.
- Analyse the success of marketing campaigns and creating reports and playbooks for best practices.

Qualifications: 
- A minimum of 6-8 years in marketing / brand management, with a recognised post graduate / graduate degree in marketing / brand / communications
- Excellent oral and written communication skills in English (other European language as a big plus - French/German).
- Research-oriented & strategic mindset. Capable to build & implement a vision for the brand and our category
- Strong organisational and management skills
- Multi-task and prioritise workload with quick turnarounds
- Excellent problem-solving skills
- Energetic and collaborative with a great work ethic
- Familiar with marketing tools and analysis including all type of research Based ideally in Paris, or in Amsterdam. With flexibility to travel





Want to come along for the ride? Let’s do this right - together.

jobs.title: Chef d'équipe
jobs.description:
We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. Our mission is to beautifully design micromobility for safety, comfort, and durability.

We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million and just released €30 million series A funding, co-led by existing investors EQT Ventures and Naspers, through its Naspers Ventures division, Axel Springer Digital Ventures, Felix Capital, FJ Labs, U-Start Club and angel investors.

Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is now operating in Brussels, Paris, Lyon, Turin, Munich & soon launching in other European cities.

Dott​ (www.ridedott.com) est une jeune entreprise de mobilité légère, électrique et partagée, à la recherche d’un responsable de site basé à Wissous (91).
Chez Dott, l’intégralité des opérations (de manutention, recharge et réparation des trottinettes) est internalisée et assurée par nos employés (mécaniciens, patrouilleurs et chauffeurs).
Rattaché à la responsable de site, votre rôle est de former, manager et animer une équipe de chauffeurs, responsables de l’échange de batterie et collecte de trottinettes à Paris.



Descriptif des missions
- **Management**
- Animer une équipe d’une quinzaine de personnesGérer les planning et les shifts
- Maintenir la cohésion et la motivation de l'équipeFormer les nouveaux salariés aux procédures & process et évaluer leurs compétences et performances
- Etre le garant de la sécurité et du bon environnement de travail des collaborateurs
- Animer l’équipe dans la recherche de solutions collectives et créer les conditions de travail collaborative
- Briefer les équipes quotidiennement et communiquer les objectifs / informations relatives à Dott
- Garantir la tenue des lieux et du matériel mis à disposition
  
- **Opérationel**
- Renseigner les KPI et suivre les indicateurs de performance opérationnels collectifs et individuels et assurer le reporting précis et rigoureux des shifts
- Être productif sur le terrain au même titre que les équipes
- Décliner les objectifs de l’entreprise en objectifs opérationnels
- Assurer l’atteinte d’objectifs de productivité (en coachant les chauffeurs sur le terrain) et de qualité (vérification de la conformité / qualité des actions effectuées par les chauffeurs)
- Etre force de proposition dans l’amélioration continue de nos process (efficacité, sécurité et environnement des chauffeurs) et de nos entrepôts
- Intervenir en cas de difficulté technique et apporter les ajustements/solutions si nécessaires
- Coordonner avec d’éventuels prestataires de transport
- Piloter l'activité quotidienne en priorisant les missions à attribuer et à distribuer auprès de votre équipe (selon les priorités fixées et la situation de la flotte)
  
- **Général**
- Assurer une veille des évolutions liées à notre activité
- Former les équipes et et les faire monter en compétence
- Assurer et garantir la sécurité de ses collaborateurs
- Faire preuve d’exemplarité
- Mettre en oeuvre les conditions permettant le respect de l’équilibre, entre vie professionnelle et vie privée
- Être le garant de la sécurité et veiller au respect du port des EPI et des procédures de sécurité en adoptant un comportement responsable
  
*Cette liste de missions est non-exhaustive.*CDI 35h par semaine, travail de nuit et de week-end

Savoir-faire : compétences techniques requises
- Possession du permis de conduire B
- Justifier de 3 à 5 ans d’expérience en Management opérationnel
- Bonne connaissance de l'environnement logistique / transport 
- Capacité à conduire un véhicule automatique et camion 20m3
- Niveau d'anglais scolaire
- Maîtrise du Pack Office et outils bureautique (Excel, Word, suite Google notamment)
- Rigueur dans l’application des règles et procédures, et le respect des consignes


Savoir être : compétences générales requises
- Qualités de communication, aisance relationnelle, leadership, exemplarité et dynamisme
- Autonomie, organisation, rigueur
- Bonne gestion du stress dans un environnement récent et mouvant

jobs.title: Community Support Representative, Italian
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. Our mission is to beautifully design micromobility for safety, comfort, and durability.

We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million and just released €30 million series A funding, co-led by existing investors EQT Ventures and Naspers, through its Naspers Ventures division, Axel Springer Digital Ventures, Felix Capital, FJ Labs, U-Start Club and angel investors.

Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is now operating in Brussels, Paris, Lyon, Turin, Munich & soon launching in other European cities.

As a Community Support Representative, you will be an integral part of the newly formed team which is taking care of Dott customer experience. You will be the voice of Dott for our customers and you will be making our users happy and loyal by solving their issues and engaging with them via email, chat and phone.

This is a unique opportunity to become part of the newly formed team early on. On top of the core job of engaging with our customers and solving their issues, you will be engaged in strike teams to build support policies, accumulate knowledge, and set up the quality system. In this job, you will not only excel in your communication and customer service skills, but also have a chance to build up project management skills and learn how mobility startups work from within.

What you'll do

  • Deliver top-notch service to our customers: you will engage with customers across different channels (email / chat / phone) regarding all sorts of issues that may arise (including safety-related) - with empathy and willingness to deliver great experience;
  • Do the research of what happened in customer’s journey before deciding how to help in each particular case;
  • Identify bugs or fraudulent behavior early on and escalate it timely to ensure minimal impact on the business;
  • Strive for efficiency: your individual performance will impact performance of the whole team (in terms of the speed and quality metrics), and will also be assessed individually.
  • On top of the core support job: you will have a chance to take part in strike teams, and contribute to building up the processes, structure, knowledge bank and product solutions for your own team from within.

What you'll need

  • Outstanding proficiency in Italian, French or German and full business proficiency in English;
  • Empathy and passion for customer service: you can interpret what the actual issue of the customer is and what could be done to transform customers’ experience and exceed their expectations;
  • Discipline and high work ethic: you are ready to work in shifts and you will always be on time for your shift; your need to be ready that your shifts from time to time will be on weekends or late in the evening;
  • Curiosity and proactiveness: you think about how you can simplify and improve the tasks you are working on, and you come up with process and product ideas; you’d be willing to share those findings with your teammates and management;
  • Being a team player: you’d be happy to coach the newbies and back up your teammates when needed;
  • Have the right to work in the EU;
  • You are based in Amsterdam or ready to relocate.

Want to come along for the ride? Let’s do this right - together.

jobs.title: Electrical Engineer
jobs.description:
We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. Our mission is to beautifully design micromobility for safety, comfort, and durability.

We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million and just released €30 million series A funding, co-led by existing investors EQT Ventures and Naspers, through its Naspers Ventures division, Axel Springer Digital Ventures, Felix Capital, FJ Labs, U-Start Club and angel investors.

Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is now operating in Brussels, Paris, Lyon, Turin, Munich & soon launching in other European cities.

We’re looking for an HQ-based electrical engineer that will design, source and implement best electrical & electronics solutions for our e-bikes and e-scooters. Your goals will be to outperform the market, in particular maximising durability, user experience and autonomy.

Responsibilities:
 - Know about all the latest tech developments in the industry (batteries, electrical motors, controllers, …)
 - Source best suppliers - worldwide - for our escooter and ebike needs
 - Find best solutions for our vehicles to reduce recharging operational costs, increase vehicle’s durability and user experience
 - Validate specs and implement best solutions for all electrical parts of our new vehicle designs (cabling, battery, motor, controller, …)
 - Negotiate terms with suppliers (prices, quality,  supply, …)
 - Create overall value for users and the business by building best hardware product on the market 
 - Drive technological advancement in all products.  

Qualifications:
 -  Experience in electrical engineering in mobility. 
 - Experience in the automotive industry, ebike or escooters is a plus.
 - Entrepreneurship mentality. Make decisions, move fast, learn and correct. 
 - Strong negotiation and vendor management skills, experience dealing with global suppliers. 
 - Strong analytical skills
 - Proficient in english, Mandarin is a plus.


Along with a competitive compensation plan, we also invite employees to participate in our employee stock option plan, plus other benefits. Want to come along for the ride? Let’s do this right - together.

jobs.title: Fleet Operations Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. Our mission is to beautifully design micromobility for safety, comfort, and durability.

We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million and just released €30 million series A funding, co-led by existing investors EQT Ventures and Naspers, through its Naspers Ventures division, Axel Springer Digital Ventures, Felix Capital, FJ Labs, U-Start Club and angel investors.

Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is now operating in Brussels, Paris, Lyon, Turin, Munich & soon launching in other European cities.

We’re looking for an entrepreneurial Fleet Operations Manager to develop operations team for Dott in Munich. This is an ideal role for early career professionals interested in developing real world management skills. You will report directly to the Operations Manager and will build and coordinate the fleet team. The job will be located in Munich.

What you'll do

  • Build and coordinate our logistics team from scratch by recruiting and training teams for Munich and Augsburg;
  • Lead a large and diverse team of drivers and e-bike riders;
  • Manage scooter fleet and ensure core KPIs are hit as you are responsible for key parts of the P&L;
  • Analyse scooter usage and demand patterns, optimise logistics cost;
  • Continuous improvement of our fleet strategy, conduct A/B testing of deployment zones and points;
  • Be the first point of contact for city officials and emergency forces;
  • Take full responsibility and ownership of projects and decisions that will impact the business.

What you'll need

  • 2+ years of experience in start-up, retail, operations management or consulting;
  • Fluent German with good knowledge of English;
  • Degree in business, natural sciences or similar studies;
  • Be able to justify your decisions to your team through data and measure the results;
  • Get your hands dirty. Work directly with your staff on the ground;
  • Strong analytical skills. You enjoy solving complex problems concerning scooter utilization and efficiency
  • Entrepreneurship mentality;
  • Make decisions, learn from your experience and repeat;
  • Done is better than perfect. We need to move fast, but be mindful of our surroundings.

Along with a competitive compensation plan, we also invite employees to participate in our employee stock option plan, plus other benefits.

Want to come along for the ride? Let’s do this right - together.

jobs.title: Frontend Engineer
jobs.description:
We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million and just released €30 million series A funding, co-led by existing investors EQT Ventures and Naspers, through its Naspers Ventures division, Axel Springer Digital Ventures, Felix Capital, FJ Labs, U-Start Club and angel investors.

Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is now operating in Brussels, Paris, Lyon, Turin, Munich & soon launching in other European cities.

We’re looking for a Frontend developer with a strong passion for crafting delightful user experience and a great attention to detail. As part of a strong and diverse platform team you will have the ability to work on consumer and internal applications, built on the latest stack to support business operations. You strive to create elegant architecture, clean testable code and a delightful user experience. You take the lead in discussion, challenge your peers and coach new joiners in getting up to speed.  


What you'll do:
- Work on high performance real-time internal web apps
- Work on our public website
- Work closely with product and design to craft the best user experience
- Define and drive development efforts using the latest web stacks 
- Coach new joiners and peers
- Assist in hiring top talent


What you'll need:
- At least 5 years of front end development experience out of which 2 years as a lead
- Excellent knowledge of modern native web technologies 
- Production experience with at least one modern web framework
- Interest in learning and applying new technologies and solutions
- Deep understanding of user experience
- High execution and ownership mindset
- Proven experience in delivering consumer applications in a timely manner
- Experience in mentoring team members
- Excellent English language and communication skills


Along with a competitive compensation plan, we also invite employees to participate in our employee stock option plan, plus other benefits.

jobs.title: IT Security Specialist (GCP)
jobs.description:
We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. Our mission is to beautifully design micromobility for safety, comfort, and durability.

We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million and just released €30 million series A funding, co-led by existing investors EQT Ventures and Naspers, through its Naspers Ventures division, Axel Springer Digital Ventures, Felix Capital, FJ Labs, U-Start Club and angel investors.

Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is now operating in Brussels, Paris, Lyon, Turin, Munich & soon launching in other European cities.

You are the go-to person for your colleagues' computer hardware and software needs, providing front line user support for all of Dott's internal tools and technologies. You troubleshoot, respond to inquiries and find solutions to technical challenges. Beyond the day-to-day, you improve the internal user experience by contributing to longer term projects and documentation efforts. You are highly technical, have proven experience with Google Cloud Platform management and are comfortable problem solving with multiple operating systems (like OS X, Linux, Windows) and a range of devices (including desktops/laptops, phone systems, video conferencing and various wireless devices).


What you'll do:
- User management (Active Directory and Cloud services on Google Cloud Platform) experience is mandatory.
- Network setup, monitoring and managing (Switches, Wifi, Access Points) in our headquarters and different operating cities.
- Partner with and lead peers, vendors and other technical support teams to coordinate troubleshooting process and resolution for incidents and problems. Act as an escalation point for particular regions, areas of expertise or technical support channels.
- Installation and configuration of Android, macOS, Microsoft Windows,  and other devices.
- Mobile device management (iOS / Android).


What you'll need: 
- 3+ years of experience as an IT support specialist; 
- Strong proven experience with Google Cloud Platform management and Google GSuite. 
- Experience in troubleshooting Windows, Mac OS, Unix, Chrome OS, networking; scripting and automation; application troubleshooting.
- Experience in creating/optimizing deployment and/or support processes for desktops/laptops, video conferencing, wireless devices, software and patches.
- Systematic problem solving approach, coupled with a sense of ownership and drive. Ability to adjust quickly to changing priorities and make progress in areas where a high ambiguity and uncertainty exist.
- Effective customer service, organizational, prioritization, multitasking, communication, and leadership skills.


Want to come along for the ride? Let’s do this right - together.

- A great mix between “ground-work” and analytics skills
- Initiative spirit, with a capacity to innovate
- A results-oriented culture and a tireless determination

- Competitive monthly salary
- Starting as soon as possible

jobs.title: Internship Operations, Paris
jobs.description:
We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. Our mission is to beautifully design micromobility for safety, comfort, and durability.

We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million and just released €30 million series A funding, co-led by existing investors EQT Ventures and Naspers, through its Naspers Ventures division, Axel Springer Digital Ventures, Felix Capital, FJ Labs, U-Start Club and angel investors.

Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is now operating in Brussels, Paris, Lyon, Turin, Munich & soon launching in other European cities.

Nous sommes présents dans plusieurs pays, dont la France qui est un des marchés les plus importants et à fort enjeu. Le marché des micro-mobilités étant en plein essor, rejoindre Dott à ses débuts afin de lancer et bâtir les opérations à Paris constitue une opportunité unique !


Ta mission 
- Rattachée à la directrice des Opérations de Paris, tu intégreras l’équipe Opérations (30 personnes) dans laquelle :
- Tu nous aideras à développer, améliorer et optimiser nos process opérationnels
- Tu travailleras à la formation et à l’amélioration des conditions de travail de nos équipes sur le terrain (mécaniciens, chauffeurs, patrouilleurs …)
- Tu participeras à la mise en place et à l’amélioration d’indicateurs pour le suivi quotidien de nos performances et de la qualité de nos opérations
- A travers de l’analyse de données, tu identifieras les leviers d’amélioration afin de permettre une croissance contrôlée et durable. Tu seras également amené à échanger avec les autres équipes européennes afin de partager les bonnes pratiques 
- Tu aideras à assurer la liaison avec nos équipes sur le terrain et tu n’hésiteras pas à mettre la main à la pâte
- Tu participeras à la révolution du transport citadin en France et dans le monde entier !


Profil recherché 
- Un mélange d'appétence pour le terrain et de capacités analytiques
- Master (école d’ingénieur, école de commerce ou équivalent universitaire)
- Autonomie, prise d’initiative et force de proposition
- Un état d’esprit tourné vers le résultat et une motivation sans faille
- Une maîtrise avancée d’Excel, des notions de bases de données (SQL) peuvent aider
- Un bon niveau d’anglais 


Les détails
- Stage entre 3 et 6 mois basé à Paris (avec déplacements fréquents à notre entrepôt de Rungis, accessible en RER C)
- Début : Juin ou Juillet 2020
- Un environnement stimulant dans une start-up en plein essor
- Possibilité d’embauche à la fin du stage


Want to come along for the ride? Let’s do this right - together.

jobs.title: Operations & Fleet Management Specialist, Rome
jobs.description:
We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. Our mission is to beautifully design micromobility for safety, comfort, and durability.

We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million and just released €30 million series A funding, co-led by existing investors EQT Ventures and Naspers, through its Naspers Ventures division, Axel Springer Digital Ventures, Felix Capital, FJ Labs, U-Start Club and angel investors.

Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is now operating in Brussels, Paris, Lyon, Turin, Munich & soon launching in other European cities.

We’re looking for an entrepreneurial Operations Specialist to develop operations team for Dott in Rome, Italy. This is an ideal role for recent graduate, or early career professional interested in developing real world management skills. The Operations Specialist will report to the Operations Manager and will build and coordinate the whole logistic team.


What you'll do:
- Build your own operations team from scratch by recruiting, training and motivating team members.
- Be a true leader to a large and diverse team of field technicians (for scooters reparation), patrollers (in charge of scooters use optimisation inside the city) and/or drivers. 
- Organise scheduling, attendance, and general administration of your operations team. 
- Maximise efficiency of fleet management & logistics by ensuring deployment, pickup and costs of dott scooters are optimised. 
- Organise and manage the flow of the workplace and optimise day-to-day activities in the warehouse.
- Overseeing operations in the warehouse from facilities and vehicle upkeep to workplace safety.
- Have an overview of the inventory and logistics.
- Maintain accurate communication with external stakeholders and carry out final decision making processes. 
- Balance attention to detail with swift execution. 
- Take full responsibility and ownership of projects and decisions that will impact the business. 


What you'll need: 
- 2+ years of experience in retail, logistics, transportation, operations management or consulting.
- Have excellent communication and people skills. 
- Be able to justify your decisions to your team through data and measure the results.
- Get your hands dirty. Work directly with your staff on the ground. Be a true leader for our marshalls and mechanics.
- Strong analytical/Excel skills a big plus.
- Fluent Italian with good knowledge of English. 
- Entrepreneurship mentality. Make decisions, learn from you experience and repeat.
- Done is better than perfect. We need to move fast, but be mindful of our surroundings.
- The goal is to make our cities better, not worse!


Along with a competitive compensation plan, we also invite employees to participate in our employee stock option plan, plus other benefits.



Want to come along for the ride? Let’s do this right - together.

jobs.title: Operations Manager, Rheinland
jobs.description:
We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. Our mission is to beautifully design micromobility for safety, comfort, and durability.

We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million and just released €30 million series A funding, co-led by existing investors EQT Ventures and Naspers, through its Naspers Ventures division, Axel Springer Digital Ventures, Felix Capital, FJ Labs, U-Start Club and angel investors.

Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is now operating in Brussels, Paris, Lyon, Turin, Munich & soon launching in other European cities.

We’re looking for an entrepreneurial operations manager to build the operational footprint for Dott covering the Reinland region of Germany. The Operations Manager will report to the Country General Manager and will work with City Marketing Managers and with Central Operations team. 


What you'll do
- Write the playbook on standard operation procedures in your city. 
- Test your thinking in real market conditions, measure results, refine your model and repeat.
- Work hand in hand with HQ in Amsterdam to translate your ideas into product changes, that'll allow you to better serve your city.
- Build a service that is liked by users and non-users alike. Be respectful and humble.
- Deep dive into operational details both in front of your computer and on the streets.
- Own maintenance and operations cost, as well as processes. Maximise the time scooters are available to users / number of trips.


What you'll need
- Fluent in English & German
- 4-6+ years of experience in logistics, operations management, investment banking or consulting. Start-up experience is a plus. 
- Entrepreneurship mentality. Make decisions, learn from you experience and repeat.
- Done is better than perfect. We need to move fast, but be mindful of our surroundings.
- The goal is to make our cities better, not worse!
- Data based decision making. Be able to justify your decisions to your team and measure the results.
- Get your hands dirty. Work directly with your staff on the ground. Be a true leader for our marshals and mechanics.
- Strong analytical/Excel skills required. SQL proficiency a big plus.


Along with a competitive compensation plan, we also invite employees to participate in our employee stock option plan, plus other benefits.

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer
jobs.description:
We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. Our mission is to beautifully design micromobility for safety, comfort, and durability.

We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million and just released €30 million series A funding, co-led by existing investors EQT Ventures and Naspers, through its Naspers Ventures division, Axel Springer Digital Ventures, Felix Capital, FJ Labs, U-Start Club and angel investors.

Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is now operating in Brussels, Paris, Lyon, Turin, Munich & soon launching in other European cities.

We’re on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. Our mission is to beautifully design micro-mobility for safety, comfort and durability.

We are a newly founded European micro-mobility start-up. We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million, co-led by EQT Ventures and Naspers. Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is gathering the most experienced team in mobility and tech in Europe.

Our UI/UX Designer will apply their natural visual and design talent to solve complex interaction design challenges. This talented core team member will spend their days sketching, designing, prototyping and detailing glorious user experiences that surprise and delight our customers. 


What you'll do
- You’re a UX/UI hybrid: You’re a hands-on, gifted visual designer who loves the clarity and cleanliness that comes from exceptional UX.
- You love Interaction design and have been designing online apps and sites for years.
- You love to own big projects and aspire to share your knowledge and experience with larger teams as you grow in your role.
- You love UI design patterns, know them well and have contributed to pattern libraries yourself.
- You finish the work… dot those “I”s and cross those “T”s.
- You communicate often and don’t get defensive when asked to elucidate your design choices.
- You are guided by experience and intuition but still make design choices and understand the reasoning behind them.
- You are self-directed, self-motivated and thrive on collaborative independence where coming together to brainstorm feeds your focused work while detailing your design.
- You love to solve complex problems with simple, elegant solutions.
- You are skilled in the leading design tools including those for rapid prototyping like Axure, XD and others.
- You understand how design systems are built. You know when to follow and when to break established interaction patterns. You champion consistency, flexibility, and reuse. You like Atomic Design, Sketch, and Zeplin.
- You understand coding and, while you may not code yourself, you know how to produce designs that can be built within frameworks, using patterns that focus energy on what matters and differentiates.
- You embrace mobile first and then work on the designs for folks still using desktops to get work done.


What you'll need
- UI/Visual Design (color, line, type, shape, image, composition).
- UX/Interaction Design (personas, flows, story maps).
- Strong knowledge of user experience/user-centered design processes and methodology.
- A passion for creating products and services that resonate emotionally with people.
- 5+ years designing products end-to-end.
- Experience designing B2B application and/or familiarity with common B2B business processes.
- Ability to function as a project leader as well as an individual contributor.
- Proficiency with visualizing, sketching, designing and prototyping user interfaces.
- Updated on the latest techniques/trends/thinking within your field and ready to share your knowledge and thoughts with both colleagues and clients.
- Ability to work within distributed, multidisciplinary teams.
- Excellent communication and facilitation skills.


Along with a competitive compensation plan, we also invite employees to participate in our employee stock option plan, plus other benefits.

Want to come along for the ride? Let’s do this right - together.

We are a newly founded startup micro-mobility European start-up, gathering the most experienced team in mobility and tech in Europe. We initially raised 20m€ at our seed on November 2018, followed recently by our Series A in July 2019 with an additional investment of €30 million, co-led by EQT Ventures and Naspers. Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is gathering the most experienced team in mobility and tech in Europe.

We’re looking for a Android developer with a strong computer science background and a great attention to detail. As part of a strong and diverse mobile team you will have the ability to work on consumer and internal applications, built on the latest stack to support business operations. You strive to create elegant architecture, clean testable code and a delightful user experience.


What you'll do:
- Work closely with product and design to craft best user experience
- Define and drive development efforts on the Android stack
- Ensure stability and scalability of the mobile architecture
- Coach new joiners and peers
- Assist in hiring top talent


What you'll need:
- At least 3 years of mobile development experience
- Excellent knowledge of Java and Kotlin
- Deep understanding of mobile architecture, design patterns and user experience
- Proven experience in delivering consumer applications in a timely manner
- Experience in mentoring team members
- Excellent English language and communication skills


Along with a competitive compensation plan, we also invite employees to participate in our employee stock option plan, plus other benefits.

Want to come along for the ride? Let’s do this right - together.

jobs.title: Warehouse Manager
jobs.description:
We are a newly-founded micromobility startup on a mission to improve European city life. We believe in a future where inner cities will be free of cars and pollution. And we believe we can make that happen by offering our dockless, shared electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel. Our mission is to beautifully design micromobility for safety, comfort, and durability.

We recently raised an initial investment of €20 million and just released €30 million series A funding, co-led by existing investors EQT Ventures and Naspers, through its Naspers Ventures division, Axel Springer Digital Ventures, Felix Capital, FJ Labs, U-Start Club and angel investors.

Dott is headquartered in Amsterdam and is now operating in Brussels, Paris, Lyon, Turin, Munich & soon launching in other European cities.




What you'll do:
- Responsibility for the warehouse P&L planning, development and execution
- Hire, train, lead and supervise a team of up to 30 people, including lead mechanics, mechanics and warehouse runners
- Co-ordinate with Ops Specialists across the whole of Rheinland and Ruhrgebiet regions
- Develop and ensure compliance with internal standards and procedures for everyone's safety: safety is your first priority
- Guarantee that productivity targets of the teams are reached as well as the quality of the operations (deployments, repairs ...) by anticipating and organizing the flows.
- Ensure and contribute to a pleasant working environment, a motivating atmosphere in a secure space for our employees, in collaboration with the HR and Administrative coordinator.
- Monitor operational performance indicators and ensure precise and rigorous reporting of activity
- Being a force for proposals in the continuous improvement of our processes (efficiency, security and environment) and our warehouse
- Participate to the introduction of new vehicle models (new scooters, bikes ...) and support the induced process changes
- Collaborate with central teams (Supply, Design & Production, Product, HR, etc.) and counterparts in other cities to share and improve processes


What you'll need:
- 5 years experience in Operational Management, logistics or transportation.
- Fluent German with good knowledge of English.
- High quality of communication, interpersonal skills, leadership, exemplarity and dynamism.
- Autonomy, organization and rigor.
- Robust crisis management and prevention in a recent and changing environment.
- Knowledge of the logistics / Transport environment highly desirable.
- Strong analytical/Excel skills a big plus.


Want to come along for the ride? Let’s do this right - together.
